metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18241 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
fs/f2fs/segment.c in the Linux kernel before 4.13 allows local users tocause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and panic) by using anoflush_merge option that triggers a NULL value for a flush_cmd_controldata structure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18241` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-143.169
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-143.169
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-143.169
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1104-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1104.112
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1108-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1108.113
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1077.87
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1041.47
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-143.169').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
